Utterance: Welcome back! How have you been since our last session?
Hey! I’ve been okay. I actually tried the muscle relaxation technique before bed, and it helped a bit.
That’s fantastic to hear! How did you feel during the exercise?
I felt really relaxed, and I actually fell asleep faster than usual.
That’s a great step forward. It sounds like you’re finding some tools that work for you. Have you been able to incorporate any writing about your feelings?
I did! I wrote a bit about my audition and how it made me feel. It was kind of cathartic.
That’s wonderful! Writing can be a great outlet. What did you discover about yourself through that process?
I realized I’m really hard on myself. I put so much pressure to succeed, and it’s exhausting.
It’s insightful that you recognize that. What do you think would happen if you eased up on that pressure?
I don’t know. I guess I’d probably enjoy music more instead of stressing about it.
That’s an important realization. What’s one small way you might allow yourself to enjoy music without the pressure of performance?
Maybe I could just sing for fun, without worrying about how I sound?
That sounds like a great idea! When could you set aside time for that?
I could try it this weekend.
Perfect! I’m excited to hear how that goes. Is there anything else on your mind today?
I’ve been thinking about my family a lot lately. I feel kind of distant from them.
Family dynamics can be complex. What do you think is causing that distance?
I don’t know. I think it’s just the pressure of everything, and I don’t want to burden them with my problems.
It’s understandable to feel that way, but remember, family can often provide support. Have you considered reaching out to them?
I haven’t, but maybe I should. I just don’t want to worry them.
That’s a valid concern. Perhaps you could share what you’re comfortable with, focusing on your feelings rather than the details of your struggles?
Yeah, I could do that.
That sounds like a healthy step. How do you feel about setting a goal to reach out this week?
I think I can manage that.
Great! It sounds like you’re making meaningful progress. Is there anything else you’d like to discuss today?
I think that’s it for now. I feel like I have some things to work on.
Absolutely! You’ve made some great strides today. I look forward to hearing about your experiences in our next session.
Thanks, Ellie. I appreciate it.
You’re welcome! Take care, and I’ll see you next time.
